sen.j: 応永年間（1394年～1428年）の初め、博多の商人肥富（こいとみ、こいつみ・こいずみとも）が明から帰国し、室町幕府3代将軍足利義満に日明貿易の利について説得した。
sen.e: At the beginning of the Oei era (1394-1428), Koitomi (or Koitsumi, Koizumi), a merchant of Hakata, came back to Japan from Ming and explained about the interest of Japan-Ming trade (the tally trade) to Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA, the third shogun of the Muromachi bakufu.

At the beginning of the period from1394 to 1428, Koitomi (also known as Koitsumi, Koizumi), a merchant of Hakata, came back to Japan from Ming and convinced Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA, the third shogun of the Muromachi bakufu of the interests of the Japan-Ming trade.

sen.j: 財政難に苦しんでいた幕府は肥富の意見を取り入れ、1401年（応永8年）に祖阿を正使に、肥富を副使として鎖国中の明に遣わせ、日明の関係を開く糸口を作らせた。
sen.e: The bakufu, which suffered from financial difficulties, adopted Koitomi's opinion and sent Soa as seishi and Koitomi as fukushi (Vice Commander) to Ming, which had taken an isolation policy, in 1401, which made the start of the relationship between Japan and Ming.
